channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tesla sales cratered in California for 7 straight quarters while rivals Toyota and Honda surge, report shows
item.description: The once-unstoppable electric-vehicle maker saw new car and truck registrations tumble 18.3% compared to the first half of last year, according to Exp...

item.title: E.P.A. Is Said to Draft a Plan to End Its Ability to Fight Climate Change
item.description: According to two people familiar with the draft, it would eliminate the bedrock scientific finding that greenhouse-gas emissions threaten human life b...

item.title: Ozzy Osbourne, Black Sabbath Lead Singer Turned Reality TV Star, Dies at 76
item.description: As the lead singer of Black Sabbath, he helped invent heavy metal. On “The Osbournes,” he presented a comedic counterpoint to his rock ’n’ roll infamy...

item.title: Trump Wants to Make It OK to Disappear People
item.description: The president’s use of migrants as bargaining chips will corrode international politics.

item.title: U.S. and Japan Reach Trade Deal
item.description: President Trump said on Tuesday that the trade deal he struck with one of America’s closest allies would impose a 15 percent tariff on Japanese export...

item.title: Officials in Iran Suspect Sabotage in Wave of Fires and Explosions
item.description: For weeks, fires and explosions have been reported almost daily in Iran. Officials are investigating what they think is a coordinated campaign.

item.title: Grizzlies Were Raiding Montana Farms. Then Came Some Formidable Dogs.
item.description: Bears have recently acquired a fondness for the good eating found around grain bins on Montana’s plains. That’s a big problem for humans and grizzlies...

item.title: North Carolina’s Bogs Have a Dirty Secret, and That’s a Good Thing
item.description: Peat bogs have huge potential to store planet-warming carbon. The ones in North Carolina just need some help to get healthy again.

item.title: Wednesday Briefing: Israel Expands Gaza Offensive
item.description: Plus, the death of Ozzy Osbourne.

item.title: Officials in Iran Suspect Sabotage in Wave of Fires and Explosions
item.description: For weeks, fires and explosions have been reported almost daily in Iran. Officials are investigating what they think is a coordinated campaign.

item.title: How Native Homes in New Mexico Are Tapping the Sun
item.description: An Indigenous-led nonprofit group is bringing solar power to Navajo Nation and the Hopi tribe, where about 15,000 households lack access to electricit...

item.title: Exclusive: Mark Cuban says AI will be a baseline skill like email or Excel in 5 years and entrepreneurs should embrace it or get left behind
item.description: The billionaire investor told Fortune new AI assistants available to entrepreneurs will help turn “solo founders into full teams.”

item.title: Eventual, a climate fintech, raises $7.5 million seed round from AlleyCorp and Upfront Ventures
item.description: Eventual’s AI model predicts how insurance prices will evolve for any given U.S. property as far ahead as five years in the future.

item.title: GM’s $1.1 billion tariff hit bolsters mounting evidence that Americans are the ones footing the bill for Trump’s import taxes
item.description: “The top-down macroevidence seems clear: Americans are mostly paying for the tariffs,” a Deutsche Bank analyst said in a note published Tuesday.

item.title: Halliburton CEO: Oil and gas markets are “softer” than expected and will remain weak for all of 2025
item.description: The oil sector braces for a bearish back half of 2025 while remaining optimistic for the long run.
